cascadess 0.1.0
  • Reference

Backgrounds

Source: R/background.R
background.Rd

The background() function adjusts the background color of a tag element.

background(x, color)

Arguments

x

A tag element or .style pronoun.
color

One of "blue", "indigo", "purple", "red", "orange", "yellow", "green", "teal", "cyan", "body", "white", or "transparent".

Buttons

Use background() to modify shiny’s action buttons.

actionButton("id", "Take action") %&gt;%
  background("green")

With a couple other functions we can take our improvement a step further.

actionButton("id", "Take action") %&gt;%
  background("green") %&gt;%
  border("green") %&gt;%
  shadow("small")

Shiny’s download buttons include ..., so we can use the .style pronoun!

downloadButton(
  .style %&gt;%
    background("white") %&gt;%
    border("blue"),
  outputId = "dwnld",
  label = "Do a download",
  class = NULL
)

Panels

sidebarLayout(
  sidebarPanel(
    .style %&gt;%
      background("blue"),
    "It's alive"
  ),
  mainPanel(
    .style %&gt;%
      background("red"),
    "It's panel"
  )
)

It’s alive

It’s panel

Colors

blue

indigo

purple

red

orange

yellow

green

teal

cyan

body

white

transparent

Examples


library(htmltools)

div(
  .style %>%
    background("white") %>%
    border("blue") %>%
    text("white"),
  "Nunc porta vulputate tellus.",
  "Suspendisse potenti."
)
#> <div class="cas-background-white cas-border-blue cas-border-all cas-border-radius-md cas-text-color-white">
#>   Nunc porta vulputate tellus.
#>   Suspendisse potenti.
#> </div>
